item.title: An object created in another class not recognized
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“shangtsung1, post:14, topic:200370”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=265049.msg2198162#msg2198162 date=1208605643]

Learn to name things. Learn to import things. Learn to use statics where appropriate. Learn that an element can be placed on the periodic table by its atomic number. Learn to erase comments. Learn to use the return key. I’ve thought of all this without even scrolling down through your shit pile.
[/quote]Learn to ride a good bike.

on behalf of nearly everyone, shut up wanker…[/quote]
It is a joke between SilverLining and I. It had nothing to do with you, fuck off.

Read full topic

Hydrogen.getSymbol()

Should be:

Elements.Hydrogen.getSymbol()
[/quote]

Or use packages.[/quote]
Define package and why (if) they would be useful here, douchebag.

(Ignore the excessive imports)

}
public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e){
    String message = " You clicked the button. woo hoo";
    if(e.getSource() == HB){

    	bob.pack();
    	bob.setVisible(true);
    }
    else if(e.getSource() == back)
    {
       bob.setVisible(false);
       
    }

}

[/code]

[code]import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.;
import javax.swing.*;
import java.awt.Component;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent;

import javax.swing.AbstractAction;
import javax.swing.Action;
import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

public class Element {

private String Symbol;
private int Protons;
private int AtomicNumber;
private int Electrons;
private int Neutrons;
private int group;
private int row;
private double AtomicMass;
private int ValenceElectrons;
private String PictureLocation;

public Element(int p,String Symbol1,
               int row1,int col1, double AtomicMass1,
               int ve1, String pl1) {
   Protons = p;
   Electrons = p;
   AtomicNumber = p;
   Symbol = Symbol1;
   group = col1;
   row = row1;
   AtomicMass = AtomicMass1;
   ValenceElectrons = ve1;
   PictureLocation = pl1;
  
  
  
}
    public int getProtons() {
        return Protons;
    }
    public int getNeutrons() {
        return Neutrons;
    }
    public int getElectrons() {
        return Electrons;
    }
    public String getSymbol() {
        return Symbol;
    }
    public int getgroup() {
        return group;
    }
    public int getrow() {
        return row;
    }
    public double getAtomicMass() {
        return AtomicMass;
    }
    public int getValenceElectrons() {
        return ValenceElectrons;
    }
    public String getPictureLocation() {
        return PictureLocation;
    }
    public int getAtomicNumber() {
        return AtomicNumber;
    }
    public int getTLX() {
        return row*10;
    }
    public int getTRX() {
        return row*10 + 10;
    }
    public int getBLX() {
        return row*10;
    }
    public int getBRX() {
        return row*10 + 10;
    }
    public int getTLY() {
        return group*10;
    }
    public int getTRY() {
        return group*10 + 10;
    }
    public int getBLY() {
        return group*10;
    }
    public int getBRY() {
        return group*10 + 10;
    }

}[/code]

[code]import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.;
import javax.swing.*;
import java.awt.Component;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent;

import javax.swing.AbstractAction;
import javax.swing.Action;
import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

public final class Elements {
public Element Hydrogen = new Element(1,“H”,1,1,1.00794,1,“bob”);
JPanel H; public JButton HB;
Element Helium = new Element(2,“He”,1,18,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel He; public JButton HeB;
Element Lithium = new Element(3,“Li”,2,1,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Li; public JButton LiB;
Element Beryllium = new Element(4,“Be”,2,2,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Be; public JButton BeB;
Element Boron = new Element(5,“B”,2,13,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel B; public JButton BB;
Element Carbon = new Element(6,“C”,2,14,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel C; public JButton CB;
Element Nitrogen = new Element(7,“N”,2,15,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel N; public JButton NB;
Element Oxygen = new Element(8,“O”,2,16,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel O; public JButton OB;
Element Fluorine = new Element(9,“F”,2,17,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel F; public JButton FB;
Element Neon = new Element(10,“Ne”,2,18,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Ne; public JButton NeB;
Element Sodium = new Element(11,“Na”,3,1,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Na; public JButton NaB;
Element Magnesium = new Element(12,“Mg”,3,2,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Mg; public JButton MgB;
Element Aluminun = new Element(13,“Al”,3,13,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Al; public JButton AlB;
Element Silicon = new Element(14,“Si”,3,14,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Si; public JButton SiB;
Element Phosphorus = new Element(15,“P”,3,15,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel P; public JButton PB;
Element Sulfur = new Element(16,“S”,3,16,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel S; public JButton SB;
Element Chlorine = new Element(17,“Cl”,3,17,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Cl; public JButton ClB;
Element Argon = new Element(18,“Ar”,3,18,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Ar; public JButton ArB;
Element Potassium = new Element(19,“K”,4,1,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel K; public JButton KB;
Element Calcium = new Element(20,“Ca”,4,2,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Ca; public JButton CaB;
Element Scandium = new Element(21,“Sc”,4,3,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Sc; public JButton ScB;
Element Titanium = new Element(22,“Ti”,4,4,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Ti; public JButton TiB;
Element Vanadium = new Element(23,“V”,4,5,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel V; public JButton VB;
Element Chromium = new Element(24,“Cr”,4,6,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Cr; public JButton CrB;
Element Manganese = new Element(25,“Mn”,4,7,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Mn; public JButton MnB;
Element Iron = new Element(26,“Fe”,4,8,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Fe; public JButton FeB;
Element Cobalt = new Element(27,“Co”,4,9,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Co; public JButton CoB;
Element Nickel = new Element(28,“Ni”,4,10,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Ni; public JButton NiB;
Element Copper = new Element(29,“Cu”,4,11,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Cu; public JButton CuB;
Element Zinc = new Element(30,“Zn”,4,12,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Zn; public JButton ZnB;
Element Gallium = new Element(31,“Ga”,4,13,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Ga; public JButton GaB;
Element Germanium = new Element(32,“Ge”,4,14,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Ge; public JButton GeB;
Element Arsenic = new Element(33,“As”,4,15,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel As; public JButton AsB;
Element Selenium = new Element(34,“Se” ,4,16,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Se; public JButton SeB;
Element Bromine = new Element(35,“Br”,4,17,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Br; public JButton BrB;
Element Krypton = new Element(36,“Kr”,4,18,4.00260,2,“bob”);
JPanel Kr; public JButton KrB;

}[/code]

Edit: I created the object in the class I was going to use it in. It works fine now but I want to know why it wasn’t working with the object in another class (yes I had it public).

Read full topic
item.source: An object created in another class not recognized
